Class GymAPI

  • java.lang.Object
    • GymAPI

  • public class GymAPI
extends java.lang.Object
    This class operates between the model classes and the menu driver class. It stores an ArrayList of member and an ArrayList of trainer. It also contains the store and load methods for XStream. There are other methods which query the members and trainers arraylists.
    Version:
    1.0
    Author:
    John Dennehy (Student Number: 20091408)

      • listMemberDetailsImperialAndMetric

        public java.lang.String listMemberDetailsImperialAndMetric()
        This method converts member details from the metric format to imperial format and adds both formats to a String which is then returned. Calculations: Kilos - Pounds (kgs * 2.20462) Centimetres - Inches (Centimetres * 0.393701)

        If an assessment has been completed for the user, the latest assessment weight is used. If no assessments have been completed, the weight entered at registration is used.

        Returns:
        A String that contains all members with details in both the imperial and metric format. If no members are registered, "No Registered Members" is returned.

      • listMembers

        public java.util.ArrayList<Member> listMembers()
        List all members that are in the members ArrayList.
        Returns:
        The listOfMembers ArrayList which contains all members in the members ArrayList.

      • listMembersBySpecificBMICategory

        public java.util.ArrayList<Member> listMembersBySpecificBMICategory(java.lang.String category)
        Checks if any members have the BMI category entered by the trainer. If there are members with the specified BMI category, they are added to the membersSpecificBMICategory ArrayList. This is determined by using the determineBMICategory method with the calculateBMI method from the GymUtility class. Each member and the members latest assessment are passed to the calculateBMI method. That method calculates the membersBMI. This is then passed to the determineBMICategory method which determines the BMI category of each member. If the member BMI category matches the BMI category entered by the trainer, the member is added to the membersSpecificBMICategory ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        category - The BMI category entered by the trainer.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of members with the BMI category entered by the trainer. If no members with the entered BMI category, empty ArrayList is returned.

      • listMembersWithIdealWeight

        public java.util.ArrayList<Member> listMembersWithIdealWeight()
        Checks if any members are of ideal weight. Loops through the members ArrayList. If members are in the ideal weight range, they are added to the membersWithIdealWeight ArrayList. This is determined by using the isIdealBodyWeight method in the GymUtility class. Each member and the members latest assessment are passed to this method. That method returns a boolean value: true if ideal weight, false if not. If GymUtility.isIdealBodyWeight is true, the member is added to the membersWithIdealWeight ArrayList.
        Returns:
        ArrayList of members with ideal weight. If no members are of ideal weight, an empty ArrayList is returned.

      • load

        public void load()
          throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to load the data from the xml file "userData.xml" (xStream). All relevant classes are added to the classes class to enable xStream to allow these to be processed without running an error. The trainers and members are loaded upon application start.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception

      • numberOfMembers

        public int numberOfMembers()
        Method to get the number of members in the members ArrayList.
        Returns:
        The size of the members ArrayList.

      • numberOfTrainers

        public int numberOfTrainers()
        Method to get the number of trainers in the trainers ArrayList.
        Returns:
        The size of the trainers ArrayList.

      • searchMembersByEmail

        public Member searchMembersByEmail(java.lang.String emailEntered)
        Allows trainers to search for members by inputting an email. Loops through the members ArrayList to check if the email entered matches any of the registered member emails.
        Parameters:
        emailEntered - The email entered by the trainer.
        Returns:
        Null if the email entered does not equal any of the existing member emails. Returns relevant member if exact match found with email inputted.

      • searchMembersByName

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchMembersByName(java.lang.String nameEntered)
        Allows trainers to search for members by inputting a name. Loops through the members ArrayList to check if the name entered partially or fully matches any of the member names. If a partial or full match is found, the member is added to the memberMatches ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        nameEntered - The name entered by the trainer.
        Returns:
        If partial or full name match is found, the member is added to the memberMatches ArrayList. Once the members ArrayList has been looped through, the memberMatches ArrayList is returned. Empty ArrayList returned if no partial or full matches are found in the members ArrayList.

      • searchTrainersByEmail

        public Trainer searchTrainersByEmail(java.lang.String emailEntered)
        Allows members to search for trainers by inputting an email. Loops through the trainers ArrayList to check if the email entered matches any of the registered trainer emails.
        Parameters:
        emailEntered - The email entered by the member.
        Returns:
        Null if the email entered does not equal any of the existing trainer emails. Returns relevant trainer if exact match found with email inputted.

      • searchTrainersByName

        public java.util.ArrayList<java.lang.String> searchTrainersByName(java.lang.String nameEntered)
        Allows members to search for trainers by inputting a name. Loops through the trainers ArrayList to check if the name entered partially or fully matches any of the trainer names. If a partial or full match is found, the trainer is added to the trainerMatches ArrayList.
        Parameters:
        nameEntered - The name entered by the member.
        Returns:
        If partial or full name match is found, the trainer is added to the trainerMatches ArrayList. Once the trainers ArrayList has been looped through, the trainerMatches ArrayList is returned. Empty ArrayList returned if no partial or full matches are found in the trainers ArrayList.

      • store

        public void store()
           throws java.lang.Exception
        This method is used to save the data to the xml file "userData.xml" (xStream). All relevant classes are added to the classes class to enable xStream to allow these to be processed without running an error. The trainers and members are saved upon application exit and when an existing trainer or member has been updated.
        Throws:
        java.lang.Exception
